analyzed: buddhagadyaya buddhagajjaya
translated: Buddha's prose, Buddha's victory

analyzed: namaḥ buddhāya
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

analyzed: namaḥ samantabhadrāya sarva gocara cakṣue
translated: Homage to Samantabhadra, the eye of all experience,

analyzed: karuṇā amṛta kallola sindhave sūryyabandhave
translated: To the ocean of waves of the nectar of compassion, to the kinsman of the sun,

analyzed: jaya jaya dharmmarāja jana kṛta śarmma pūja
translated: Victory, victory, O Dharma King, worshipped with the merit of the people,

analyzed: asadṛśa buddha līla ati pariśuddha śila
translated: With a Buddha's play unmatched, with a purity of conduct most refined,

analyzed: sphuṭita gabhasti jāla bahuvidha visva pala
translated: With a net of rays that burst forth, with many kinds of wondrous things,

analyzed: jagati nirasta dosa praṇamita śasta veṣa
translated: In the world, faults removed, with praise offered,

analyzed: rucira vimukti bhūṣa magadha viśiṣṭa bhāṣa
translated: With beautiful liberation as adornment, with the most distinguished speech of Magadha,

analyzed: daṇḍita bahu māra khaṇḍita bhava bhāra
translated: With many Maras punished, with the burden of existence shattered,
With auspicious verses of praise, with the lord of learned people,

analyzed: añcita padapāta sañcita hita jāta  sāra hari vara śayana tāmarasa nibha nayana
translated: With words arranged, with the accumulation of benefits produced,🔽With the best of strong men as bed, with eyes like lotus flowers,

analyzed: loka jana sukha karaṇa lola sura nata caraṇa
translated: With the bringing of happiness to people and gods, with feet bowed to by playful gods,

analyzed: kāla jaya caturatara śiladhara divasakara
translated: With skill in conquering time, with a mountain of virtue, with a sun,

analyzed: sura nara pūjanīya ārya budha jana bodhana avīrya
translated: With the removal of the ignorance of young people, with the bringing of control to the restless,🔽To be worshipped by gods and men, with the vigor of teaching the noble ones,

analyzed: para hita sādhana akāryya tribhuvana śāsana ācāryya
translated: With the means of accomplishing the welfare of others, with the conduct of ruling the three worlds,

analyzed: dānava ari padma āsana stha dhīra pūta citra āsana stha
translated: Seated on a lotus throne, pure-minded, seated on a variegated seat,

analyzed: vīta moha rudrāsanastha bodhi mūla vajrāsanastha
translated: Seated on a seat of Rudra, free from ignorance and delusion, seated on the vajra seat at the Bodhi tree,
Knowing the salutations of the qualities of the lord of sacrifices, clearly knowing the best of the supports of knowledge,

analyzed: ajñāna ari bala prahara jña prajñā dhāna mahat ṣaṣ abhijña
translated: Knowing how to strike the forces of the enemy of ignorance, the great support of wisdom, possessing the six higher knowledges,

analyzed: dhiṣaṇā maya sāra sāyaka vipadā kula hetu hāyaka
translated: The arrow of the essence of the six perfections, the destroyer of the causes of the turmoil of misfortune,

analyzed: ajara amara bhūti dāyaka sa carācara loka nāyaka
translated: The giver of the state of being free from old age and death, the leader of the world with its moving and unmoving beings,🔽Having a voice that is well-known, soft, and cool, receiving worship from the gods,

analyzed: suśruta jana māyā ānandana viśruta kula māyā ānandana
translated: Delighting the people who are well-known and delightful, delighting the people who are well-known and delightful,

analyzed: iṣṭa vinaṣṭa samujjhita kopa tuṣṭa variṣṭha vivarjita pāpa
translated: Having abandoned anger towards those who are desired and destroyed, being the best of the satisfied, free from evil,

analyzed: śiṣṭa viśiṣṭa vinirjjita tāpa aṣṭa catuṣṭaya lakṣaṇa rūpa
translated: Having conquered the heat of the best of the virtuous, having the form of the eight and four characteristics,

analyzed: yogya bhāva gaṇanā hṛta sīma bhāgya dāya jana modana rāma
translated: Having gathered the limits of the calculation of the multitude of suitable states, delighting the people who give good fortune,

analyzed: vākya leśa pariśoṣita kāma sākya rāja kula sāgara soma  prerita śāsana nīti viśāla dhārita bodhi manohara mūla
translated: Having dried up desire with a mere portion of speech, the moon in the ocean of the Shakya royal family,🔽Having the vast conduct of the inspired teachings, upholding the delightful root of enlightenment,

analyzed: vārita māra vadhū jana līla pūrita pāramitā daśa śīla
translated: Having stopped the play of the wives of Mara, having fulfilled the ten perfections and morality,
The sun whose rays shine with the luster of gold, the region adorned with the luster of gold,

analyzed: śyāma prabhā pūraṇa anargha keśa vyāma prabhā lokaka prakāśa  cīrṇa akhila jñāna yoga ṛddhi candra
translated: The hair of the head filled with priceless luster, the light of the world shining with the luster of a fathom,🔽The moon accomplished by the yoga of all knowledge, the moon accomplished by the cutting of the full lip,

analyzed: pūrṇa āgama khyāta dhīra arddhacandra ūrṇā ruci cheda bāla arddhacandra
translated: The half-moon known in the full scriptures, the half-moon of childhood cut by the luster of the tuft,🔽The lord of the rising pot, the king of the universe, praised by the lord of the thunderbolt, the king of the barley,
The king of good deeds shining like the ocean, the king of the good Dharma of the lord of speech of the ocean of Shambhu,

analyzed: nikuñcat bhava ādīnava aśeṣa buddha sat añcat guṇa āveśa śīla ādi śuddha
translated: The Buddha whose entire ignorance of worldly existence is contracted, whose nature is pure with the infusion of virtues and so on,

analyzed: viriñcat prabhā bheda śobhā ādi siddha udañcat mahā ketu mālā anubaddha
translated: The one whose splendor is beautiful with the distinction of Brahma's radiance, accomplished and so on, followed by a great garland of banners,

analyzed: anu samaya śubha sāra bhāṣaṇa atula guṇa dhara vīta bhīṣaṇa
translated: Speaking the essence of auspiciousness according to the occasion, possessing incomparable qualities, free from fear and terror,

original: atimalinabhavarāgaroṣaṇa aparamitavaraśīlabhūṣaṇa🔽prasuta prahita prasava pracala prathita praguṇa pramada praphala
analyzed: ati malina bhava rāga roṣaṇa apara mita vara śīla bhūṣaṇa  prasuta prahita prasava pracala prathita praguṇa pramada praphala
translated: Free from the anger and passion of extremely dirty worldly attachment, adorned with the supreme virtue of good conduct,🔽Proceeding, sent, producing, moving, famous, of good quality, delightful, fruitful,

analyzed: praṇata pracura prabhava pradala prakaṭa praṇaya pratima prabala
translated: Submissive, abundant, producing, bestowing, manifest, affectionate, rival, powerful,

analyzed: nistāri vikhyāta viśva jana śaraṇa
translated: The refuge of the world renowned for liberation, the auspicious maker of the multitude of brave and generous ones,

analyzed: śasta ari sat tyāga siddha kara caraṇa vistāri ṣaṣ bheda varṇa vara kiraṇa
translated: The destroyer of true generosity, with accomplished hands and feet, the expander of the excellent rays of the six different colors,🔽The arranger of the manifest, the association of the virtuous people, the maker of devotion, the respectful honor and so on, the sweet bee,

analyzed: bhakti dhara saṃsāra bheda raṇa raṅga mukti pura kalyāṇa moda muni tuṅga
translated: The stage of cutting through the differences of devotion and worldly existence, the joy of the city of liberation, the bliss of the great sage,

analyzed: sarasija niśruta viracita tantra sapadi tiraskṛta bhava bhaya yantra
translated: The tantra composed on the lotus seat, the machine of worldly fear eclipsed by the word,

analyzed: budha jana śikṣita bahuvidha tantra tribhuvana viśruta nava guṇa mantra
translated: The many kinds of tantra taught to the wise, the mantra of the nine qualities renowned in the three worlds,

analyzed: bahu lola kathanīya rāva adhirāva guṇa śīla mahanīya sevā adhiseva
translated: The service of praiseworthy virtue and character, the best of the best of many kinds of praiseworthy speech,

analyzed: a vipāka ramaṇīya bhāva adhibhāva jagat eka garaṇīya deva adhideva
translated: The best of gods, the sole protector of the world, the manifestation of delightful non-decay,

analyzed: tapana śaśi śikhi mahaḥ satya avabodhana anaya kula maya tapaḥ satya avabādhana
translated: The true understanding of the light of the sun, moon, and stars, the true overcoming of the austerities of the lineage of bad conduct,

analyzed: aparimita guṇa vacaḥsatya avasādhana sakala jana hita catur satya avabodhana
translated: The true accomplishment of the words of immeasurable qualities, the true understanding of the four truths for the benefit of all people,
Destroyer of the wheel of many actions that leads to bad destinies, increaser of the wheel of many actions that leads to good destinies

analyzed: dugati maya bhava karmma cakra pramarddana jagati kṛta vara dharmma cakra pravarttana
translated: Destroyer of the wheel of actions that lead to existence full of bad destinies, turner of the wheel of the supreme Dharma for the world

analyzed: siddha āgama sadbhāvana su jñāpita pāka buddha āgama vikhyāpana vijñāpita nāka
translated: Well-known through the ripening of the true nature of the teachings of the Siddhas, known through the proclamation of the teachings of the Buddha

analyzed: śuddha āgama visphāraṇa vidhmāpita śoka ṛddhi āgama vistāraṇa vijñāpita loka  mṛta sa mṛd maya anna pātra labdha devatām cana vatsala tva dhāma gātra lupta śobhakān cana
translated: Expanding the pure teachings, dispelling sorrow, known through the expansion of the teachings of spiritual powers, known to the world🔽Having obtained a golden bowl made of clay from the gods, having a body of compassion, with a golden beauty that has disappeared

analyzed: utsa vṛnda śītamañju citra jāti vāñcana sat samantakūṭa śṛṅga datta pāda lāñchana  prathita carita saṅga gīti vīta kadana amita vimala dharmma śīla nīti sadana
translated: Having feet marked with the auspicious signs of a multitude of festivals, a cool and beautiful complexion, and a beautiful birth

analyzed: bahula dhavala puñja hāra cāru radana śiśirakiraṇa maṇḍala abhirāma vadana
translated: Having a face beautiful with a mass of abundant white hair, a face delightful with a cool halo of light

analyzed: jāta divasīyam aham odita pitāmaha vīta mala loka hita pūta kuśala āvaha
translated: Having a grandfather delighted by the great joy of the day of birth, bringing pure and wholesome benefit to the world free from impurities

analyzed: bāhu bala ghora raṇa māra bahu vīra ha rāhu nayana a viṣaya pāda sarasīruha
translated: Having feet like lotus flowers, not within the range of sight of the eyes of Rahu, the many heroes of Mara in the terrible battle of Bala
The one who destroys the forms and names of the terrible passions of love, anger, and attachment, with words that are the essence of the abundant Soma of the limit of the multitude of love

analyzed: vāmadeva kāma nātha sāma pāda rodhana hema rāśi dhāma cāru nāma rūpa śobhana
translated: The one who obstructs the feet of the Sama hymns of Vamadeva and Kama, the one whose name and form are beautiful like a golden heap, the one who shines

analyzed: vāda baddha visphurat kudṛṣṭi dṛṣṭi sañcaya bheda citta sambhava prapañca patti sañcaya  pāda padma sañcarat praphulla padma sañcaya veda siddha śemuṣī prabhagna bhedya sañcaya  akhila loka pūjita prahita sarva śocana sakala tāpa vedana prabhava saṅga mocana
translated: The one who destroys the multitude of conceptual thoughts that arise from the mind, the multitude of conceptual thoughts that are the collection of views of the fluctuating bad views bound by words🔽The one who destroys the multitude of objects to be destroyed, the multitude of blooming lotuses that move on the lotus feet, the multitude of the Vedic conclusions🔽The one who is worshipped by all worlds, the one who removes all sorrows, the one who liberates from the confluence of the origin of all afflictions and knowledge

analyzed: madhura sāra śītala prakaṭa bhavya vācana nirvaśeṣa gocara pratata buddhi locana  kiraṇa nivaha pramaṇḍita vitata puṣkara kaluṣa haraṇa sphurat nava lalita puṣkara
translated: The one whose words are sweet, cool, and auspicious, the one whose eyes of intelligence are extended to the entire range without exception🔽The one whose large lotus is adorned with a multitude of rays, the one whose new and beautiful lotus shines in removing impurities

analyzed: gamana samaya svayam nada damita puṣkara sakala bhuvana priyaṅkara caraṇa puṣkara
translated: The one whose lotus feet are always praised at the time of going, the one whose lotus feet are pleasing to all worlds

analyzed: nitya peśala nitya dakṣiṇa nitya bhāva tathāgata nitya bhāsura nitya deśita nitya bhāva tathāgata
translated: The one who is always skillful, always generous, always existent Tathagata, the one who is always radiant, always taught, always existent Tathagata

analyzed: nitya vismaya nitya vatsala nitya moda tathāgata nitya maṅgala nitya sundara nitya pūjya tathāgata
translated: Nitya-vismaya-nitya-vatsala-nitya-moda-tathagata, Nitya-mangala-nitya-sundara-nitya-pujya-tathagata

analyzed: trividha śubha calana vara jalaja nibha yugala vinaya maya vividha manu samita durita gala
translated: Trividha-subha-calana-navana-jalaja-nibha-yugala, Vinaya-maya-vividha-manusa-mita-durita-gala

analyzed: mathita bahu viṣaya bhara bharita bhava nigala praṇata sura makuṭa maṇi ghaṭita pada yugala  helā viracita dolāyita jana mūla āgama vidhi dīpana vāṭa hālāhala nibha śālā bhava śubha līlā vidalana śāsana jhāṭa
translated: Mathita-bahu-vishaya-bharabharita-bhava-nigala, Pranata-sura-makutamani-ghatika-pada-yugala🔽Hela-viracita-dolayita-jana-mula-agama-vidhi-dipana-vata, Halahala-nibha-sala-bhavasubha-lila-vidarana-sasana-jata

analyzed: bāla anaya mati jāla ādara hara śīla āyudha dhara vārida kūṭa kolāhala kara nālā giri gaja kāla ākṛti mada vega vighāṭa
translated: Balana-ayamatidjala-darahara-sila-ayudhadhara-varidika-kutra, Kolahala-kara-nala-giri-gaja-kala-akrtimada-vega-vidhata

analyzed: vana mudita vispaṣṭa madhuratara nāda jana hṛdaya maddhya stha kamala mṛdu pāda
translated: Vana-mudita-vispashta-madhura-tarana-nada, Jana-hridhaya-madhya-stha-kamala-mrdhu-pada

analyzed: vinaya bala viccinna durita kula bheda anavarata saddharmma vitaraṇa vinoda
translated: Vinaya-bala-vicchinnatura-itakula-bheda, Ananavata-sadharma-vitarana-vinota

analyzed: aruṇa pada tala sakala viṣayaka vimala daśavidha mati bala karuṇa jalanidhi lahari parikara satata kuśalita mahi tala
translated: Aruna-padatala-sakala-vishayaka-vimapta-dasha-vidha-matabala-karuna-jalani-dhilahara-parikara-satata-kusha-litamita-tal

analyzed: viśada dinamaṇi kiraṇa vikasita kamala mṛdu tala kara tala daśa diś upagata surabhi kula vara vadana vikasita parimala
translated: With the softness of the palm of a hand, the fragrance of the excellent faces of the bees that have spread in the ten directions, the fragrance that has blossomed from the lotuses that have opened with the rays of the sun-gem of the clear day,

original: anagham atimanojñaṃ dharmmarājasya gadyaṃ likhati paṭhati yo vā sādaraṃ yaś śruṇoti
analyzed: anagham ati manojñam dharmmarājasya gadyam likhati paṭhati yaḥ vā sa ādaram yaḥ śruṇoti
translated: The prose of Dharmaraja, which is sinless and extremely delightful, he who writes or reads it with respect, or listens to it

original: tribhuvanabhavanāntaḥ prāpya bhogān aśeṣān anubhavati sa nityaṃ śāntanirvāṇasaukhyam /
analyzed: tribhuvana bhavana antar prāpya bhogān aśeṣān anubhavati sa nityam śānta nirvāṇa saukhyam
translated: Having attained all enjoyments in the inner quarters of the three worlds, he always experiences the bliss of peaceful nirvana.

analyzed: siddhiḥ astu śubham astu
translated: May there be success. May there be auspiciousness.

analyzed: nimi
translated: In the prose of the Buddha.
